title: Relativity shelves Terran 1 after one launch, redesigns Terran R
summary: Relativity Space has decided to retire its Terran 1 small launch vehicle after a single flight that failed to reach orbit, focusing its resources on a revised version of its larger Terran R rocket.

title: Amid commercial boom, U.S. military lacks timely access to satellite imagery
summary: The way in which commercial imagery is procured by the government does not necessarily support military commanders’ needs for timely intelligence, officials said at the Planet Explore 2023 conference.

title: Europe is about to launch one of its most ambitious missions ever
summary: "We wanted to see if these were possible habitats for life."

title: Inmarsat and MediaTek expand direct-to-device partnership
summary: Inmarsat and Taiwanese chipmaker MediaTek announced plans April 12 to jointly develop technologies needed to enable more mass market devices to connect directly to the British satellite operator’s network.

title: ESA set to launch JUICE to Jupiter’s icy moons atop Ariane 5
summary: European Space Agency (ESA) and Arianespace teams are now ready for the launch of the historic Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer (JUICE) mission to the three largest icy moons of Jupiter — Ganymede, Callisto, and Europa. The launch, dubbed Flight VA260, will be the first of two Ariane 5 missions of 2023 and the penultimate flight of the Ariane 5 rocket, lofting JUICE on a trajectory that will result in a summer 2031 arrival and orbit insertion at the Jovian system.

title: Delivering Data: What customers get wrong about the ground segment
summary: Through packaged services, partnerships and APIs, ground segment providers aim to make communicating with satellites as easy as possible. That does not mean that operators can wait until the last minute to consider data delivery.

title: Relativity Space is moving on from the Terran 1 rocket to something much bigger
summary: Relativity Space is not going to launch again until at least 2026.

title: Relativity goes ‘all in’ on larger reusable rocket, shifting 3D-printing approach after first launch
summary: Relativity Space is shifting its strategy in an attempt to accelerate work on the reusable rocket it’s developing, the company announced on Wednesday. Chief among the changes: adjusting its manufacturing approach to blend its 3D-printing-first approach with traditional metal-bending techniques.

title: ISRO Successfully Completes Final Long Duration Hot Fire Test of Human-Rated Vikas Engine
summary: ISRO's Gaganyaan program, aimed at sending humans into space, has reached a significant milestone by accomplishing the final long-duration hot fire test of the human-rated L110-G Vikas Engine. The final qualification firing, conducted on April 6, 2023, at the ISRO Propulsion Complex (IPRC) in Mahendragiri, lasted for the intended 240 seconds.The air-lit liquid core stage of the human-rated launch vehicle (LVM3-G) uses two L110-G Vikas engines. With this test, all the planned qualification tests of the engine have been successfully completed.

title: Op-ed | U.S. leadership of cislunar space hinges on foresight and planning
summary: Fifty years after the conclusion of the Apollo program — arguably the greatest technological achievement in human history — the eyes of the entire world are once again fixed upon […]
